intro: Ottonia miguelitensis var. parcepilosa, commonly known as the slender-panicle ottonia, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its delicate, branched inflorescence and narrow, linear leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils, thriving in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, often arranged in dense clusters, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
